Summary: Sky was teeming with intermittent strobes, which lit up in flare-like fireballs. Strobes would seem to appear and reappear; dispursed in dif. directions.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in New Harmony
There was one other sighting in New Harmony on or around September 11th 2007
divs: sighting detailsi was looking due north when i saw a burst of orange light. this was followed by many, possibly 15 strobes, flashing intermittently while disappearing and reappearing. nearly ten bright flares were seen over an hour and fifteen minute span. one lit at about 5 degrees nne for about 5 seconds, then a second one lit at about 15 degrees that split into a pair of lights. these lasted about the same duration. as described in other reports these lights can be seen in the sky before igniting, and look like orangish or sometimes red\blue stars. typically they will be slightly moving laterally, but little enough that not noticeable to the naked eye. after several bursts in the nnw to nne area, the lights would disperse to the east\west only to converge again in the same northerly area of the sky about 20-25 minutes later. some video was captured of the single lights and of the double.
